Martin Luther King Jr. moved into an apartment on Hamlin Avenue to highlight the squalid conditions African-Americans were living in all over the country. More than a half-century later, observers both in and outside Chicago still hold up North Lawndale as an example of everything wrong with American cities.

properties.HED: Wicker Park condo building under legal siege amid claims of hazardous conditions

properties.description_link: As a legal battle over alleged shoddy work at a Wicker Park condo building winds through court, an insurance company is working to make sure it is not liable for the builder and developer’s legal woes.

properties.DEK: After demolishing the former building at 450 North Morgan St., MAB is looking to sell the lot

properties.DEK: The joint venture is planning to convert the vacant building into 56 rentals and 38K sf of commercial space
properties.description_link: A venture of Interra Realty and the Heart of America Group paid $14 million for a vacant four-story factory and surrounding property a few hundred feet from the future site of Sterling Bay’s Lincoln Yards development.

properties.HED: Discount Tire CEO buys full-floor Magnificent Mile condo for $6.25M
properties.DEK: The sale marks the 16th of $6M or more this year in the Chicago area
properties.description_link: Discount Tire CEO Michael Zuieback paid $6.25 million for a full-floor Magnificent Mile condo. It marked the 16th residential sale of more than $6 million so far this year.  At this point in 2017, only one sale over $6 million had been recorded.

properties.DEK: The New York firm is adding to its Chicago portfolio with properties in River North, South Loop

properties.HED: Lake Forest mansion listed for $15M, ranking it near top of the market

properties.HED: Blackstone Group refinances River North Point with $310M
properties.DEK: The company bought the 1.3M sf former Apparel Mart in 2015 for $378M
properties.description_link: UPDATE, July 5, 2:20 p.m.: The Blackstone Group refinanced River North Point, formerly known as the Apparel Mart, with a $310 million loan from Goldman Sachs, paying off a $245 million mortgage with Wells Fargo.

properties.HED: Prime Group adding 234-key canopy hotel atop Loop Marriott

properties.DEK: The insurance tech company will more than double its footprint in the move to 222 North LaSalle

properties.HED: Hotel Capital buys River North Hotel for $26M
properties.DEK: The 122-key hotel is being upgraded amid a tourism surge along the Magnificent Mile

properties.HED: Park N’ Fly acquires 10-acre lot near Midway
properties.DEK: The subsidiary of the Netherlands-based BCD Group secured a $14M loan
properties.description_link: A subsidiary of the Dutch travel company BCD Group bought a 10-acre property near Midway International Airport for a Park N’ Fly commuter lot, according to Cook County property records.

properties.HED: Bixby Bridge Capital secures $31M loan on Kinzie Hotel
properties.DEK: The investor terminated its mortgage in April with Deutsche Bank on the 215-key River North inn
properties.description_link: Bixby Bridge Capital refinanced its Kinzie Hotel with a $30.5 million loan from Annaly, two months after terminating its mortgage with Deutsche Bank.

properties.HED: As developers cash in on Logan Square, one property owner has become the face of gentrification
properties.DEK: Mark Fishman isn't the only one renovating apartments and hiking rents, so why is he vilified?
properties.description_link: Most renters couldn’t identify the owner of their apartment, but for Mark Fishman, there’s no hiding behind a corporation. The landlord and his firm, M. Fishman & Co., have become the face of gentrification in fast-developing Logan Square. With a history of gobbling up properties and sharply lifting rents, he has raised the ire of the local residents who feel they are being priced out and pushed out of their neighborhood. Fishman is so well known that his name is posted on properties that don’t belong to him — and that aren’t even rentals.

properties.HED: Movers & Shakers: Bruce Hopple joins Avison Young, Berkshire promotes Jim Ziltz & more
properties.DEK: Centerpoint names Elena Daniel VP and WiredScore taps Colliers’ Christine Torres
properties.description_link: Avison Young hired Bruce Hopple as a senior vice president in its Chicago office.

properties.HED: Developers ratchet up feud over two River North properties
properties.DEK: Jaime Javors and James Porritt are back in court for a 5th time over the sites
properties.description_link: Developers Jaime “Jay” Javors and James “Jake” Porritt are showing no signs of ending their raging feud over a pair of disputed River North properties.

properties.HED: Sterling Bay’s John Gavin leaving for BDT Capital Partners
properties.DEK: Gavin departs the firm as it ramps up plans for ambitious Lincoln Yards project
properties.description_link: Sterling Bay principal John Gavin is leaving for BDT Capital Partners. The departure comes as pushes its plans for the 70-acre Lincoln Yards megadevelopment along the North Branch of the Chicago River, one of its many large-scale projects around the city.

properties.HED: Zeller Realty takes out $215M mortgage on distinctive Downtown skyscraper

properties.HED: Here are the 10 largest construction permits issued in Chicago in March

properties.HED: Is Chicago ready for co-living?

properties.description_link: Berlin-based Medici Living Group is bringing its first Quarters co-living location to Chicago next week.

properties.HED: Back to the future: MCZ returns to original plan for 20-story residential tower

properties.HED: Sterling Bay closes on $680M acquisition of Prudential Plaza
properties.DEK: Deal marks Chicago's largest office building sale since 2015
properties.description_link: Sterling Bay has closed on a $680 million purchase of Prudential Plaza, the massive two-building complex at 130 East Randolph Street, a source close to the deal has confirmed.

properties.HED: Will Compass’ Chicago ambitions send its rivals spinning?
properties.DEK: “We are not some evil empire trying to take over the world.”
properties.description_link: In early March, a 25-foot-wide billboard went up at 3033 North Clark Street in Lakeview. On it was a cartoon of a mustachioed, fedora-clad old-timer with Groucho Marx eyebrows, clasping a giant compass. Splashed next to him, right above an @properties logo, were the ominous words: “Don’t ask for directions from a tourist.”

properties.HED: 601W Companies closes on Sullivan Center office space
properties.DEK: The firm also has taken out a $88 million loan on a foreclosed West Loop office tower
properties.description_link: The 601W Companies, among Chicago’s most prominent office landlords, has picked up part of a landmarked State Street property and taken out a mortgage on a foreclosed West Loop office tower.

properties.HED: Bill and Giuliana Rancic asking triple purchase price on Gold Coast townhouse
properties.DEK: “The Apprentice-Season 1” winner and his wife gut renovated the 1886 home
properties.description_link: Bill Rancic, winner of the first season of “The Apprentice” and his wife, entertainment news personality Giuliana Rancic, are selling their Gold Cost Victorian townhouse. And they’re looking to turn a hefty profit after extensive renovations on the 130-year-old home.

properties.HED: A group of investors are taking over the landmark Delaware Building
properties.DEK: Led by attorney Steven DeGraff, the new owners could redevelop the property for co-working or housing
properties.description_link: An investment group has taken control of the landmark Delaware Building nearly three years after filing a foreclosure suit against the previous owner, county records show.
